page.title: 03Footpaths, Ecology in Upton.
page.content: A large No. of footpaths radiate from Upton leading off into the interesting villages surrounding the town.One abounding in local{flora and fauna starts from the playing field in the direction of the cholera burial ground and a small nature reserve.The town is criss crossed with alleyways which in ancient times were the old roads and are now much used rights of way.The river banks are very popular walking grounds for those who enjoy easy walking with the chance to look and listen to the many sights and sounds of nature.The path starting from the Ham can be walked to Tewkesbury.Over the bridge the right path leads past the Marina along Ryall Meadow to the historic village of Ripple.The path to the left leads either along the old tow path to Severn Stoke or diagonally across Fish Meadow to Earls Croome.
